args.natural_language_statement: Translate: Suppose f : ℝ^n → ℝ is C^1 in a neighborhood of x0 (i.e. has continuous first derivative near x0). Then f is differentiable at x0. More generally, in the setting of real normed spaces, show that cont_diff_at ℝ 1 f x0 implies differentiable_at ℝ f x0. Produce a Lean 4 statement importing Mathlib at the top and end the Lean4 statement with ":= by sorry".

result:

args.query: mathlib4 cont_diff_at differentiable_at cont_diff_at implies differentiable_at Mathlib

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {E F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E]
  [NormedAddCommGroup F] [NormedSpace ℝ F]

/-- If f is C^1 at x (i.e., cont_diff_at ℝ 1 f x), then f is differentiable at x. -/
theorem cont_diff_at.one_imp_differentiable_at {f : E → F} {x : E} (h : ContDiffAt ℝ 1 f x) :
    DifferentiableAt ℝ f x := by sorry
